sub_title: I build the extraordinary. Solving problems and changing the world. One line of code at a time.
summary:
I am a results-driven software engineering professional with a specialization in financial technology. One of my proudest achievements includes successfully implementing FinMechanics FM Converge at Absa Group Ltd during a crucial demerger from Barclays, contributing to seamless financial operations.

As a problem-solver, I approach challenges with a meticulous understanding of the domain, conducting root cause analysis to identify underlying issues, and then devising effective resolutions. This methodology has proven invaluable in handling complex situations with perseverance and a calm demeanor.

To stay at the forefront of my field, I remain actively engaged with industry trends and advancements. I rely on LinkedIn, TLDR;, Udemy and YouTube as my go-to resources for continuous learning and professional development.

Beyond the realm of technology, my curiosity knows no bounds. My eagerness to understand everything I work with extends to all areas of life, driving me to explore and expand my knowledge.

Let's connect and explore potential opportunities to create high-quality and scalable software-based solutions together!

contributors.headline: I build the extraordinary. Solving problems and changing the world. One line of code at a time.

projects.title: NWW migration to public cloud
projects.description:
The Ministry of general affairs is responsible for the coordination of general government policy and government communications. As part of the government by communications the ministry of general affairs owns multiple websites and web apps which require further development and maintenance.

A devops team of seven was tasked to re-build the NWW nederlandwereldwijd.nl group of websites from traditional on-prem applications to cloud native microservices while implementing automated devops tools and workflows to streamline requirements into production while still maintaining the quality of the solutions and comply with all security requirements. 

As a devops engineer, I was responsible for working with our hosting provider to set up Openshift clusters and infrastructure around the cluster in the public cloud. I was responsible for provisioning all the application environments, implementing and integrating the devops CI/CD tools used by multiple developer teams as well as implementing and integrating observability and monitoring for applications and processes.

I also collaborated with stakeholders on further development of tools and workflows, and security incidents and improvements.

contributors.headline: I build the extraordinary. Solving problems and changing the world. One line of code at a time.

projects.title: Capricorn Group Treasury implementation
projects.description:
Capricorn Group, a holding company with subsidiaries in the corporate finance domain, is upgrading the current legacy treasury solutions of subsidiaries, Bank Windhoek and Bank Gabarone, to improve business processes and workflows, gain added functionality and comply with regulations. 

A team of six consisting of a project manager, business lead, two business analysts and two software engineers implemented a multi-tendency on-prem instance of FinMechanics’ Canvas platform and integrate the solution into existing systems of Capricorn Group.

As a software engineer, I was responsible for requirements gathering, design of the multi-tendency platform architecture in collaboration with the vendor and client, collaborating with stakeholders on both the client side and vendor side. I was also responsible for the infrastructure provisioning, installation of the vendor software and the design and development of integration microservices into existing platforms

contributors.headline: I build the extraordinary. Solving problems and changing the world. One line of code at a time.

projects.title: Finmio Treasury Cloud Platform POC
projects.description:
42 Market’s FinMio is a digital services start-up, focusing on providing SaaS to the global banking and insurance industry.  As part of their service offering, they required a proof of concept for a potential client.

A team of five, consisting of a solution architect, infrastructure- and software engineers was tasked to build a proof of concept of a cloud native SaaS platform on AWS, providing a modular, web-based treasury solution. The platform enables clients to create and manage treasury environments on-demand. The platform also offers a subscription and usage-based billing model, providing clients a cost-effective treasury solution. 

As a software engineer, I was responsible for re-engineering and containerising an existing web-based treasury platform to be more cloud optimized. I also designed and developed core microservices encapsulating the cloud optimized treasury solution, which integrated with AWS Cloud. I also developed a React platform user interface.

contributors.headline: I build the extraordinary. Solving problems and changing the world. One line of code at a time.

projects.title: Absa FX Options Trading Platform
projects.description:
Absa Group is one of Africa’s largest financial services provider across retail, corporate and investment banking. As part of a de-merger, Absa Group needed to replace Barclay's FX Options trading functionality by FinMechanics’ Converge platform. Timelines were fixed, as not meeting the de-merger deadlines could’ve resulted in financial penalties.
 
The team of seven, consisting of a project manager, business lead, solutions architect, two business analysts and two software engineers, was tasked to do an on-prem installation of the FM Converge platform and integrate the solution into new- and existing systems of Absa Group Limited.

As a software engineer on the team, my responsibilities included collaborating with stakeholders on both the client side and vendor side. Furthermore, I was responsible for the infrastructure provisioning, setting up deployment strategies of the vendor software, design and development of containerised integration microservices and ensured all non-functional requirements were met.

After go-live I also provided 3rd line technical support.

projects.title: StellCap Exposure Management System
projects.description:
StellCap* is a financial services provider offering currency and exposure risk management to their clients. As a start-up they required a web-based platform allowing their clients to manage foreign currency positions. 

An agile team of seven was tasked to build a multi-tendency web-based application from scratch with integrations into existing exchange rate streaming systems.

My role as a full-stack developer was to design, build and test microservices (front-end, backend and integrations).

* Since my departure the platform has been rebranded to FX Flow (https://fxflow.co)
